result.execSummary:
The defendant Sandrea M Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: Pay restitution in the amount of $1280.00 to Crystal M. or, if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.
Pay all costs and surcharges or, if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.

No contact with Crystal M.
No contact with Skybox Sportsbar.

Mental health assessment/treatment.
Letter of apology to Crystal M.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sandrea M Smith

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Sandrea M Smith in court with attorney Joel Alan Mogren.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Counsel is newly appointed on this matter.  Defense counsel advised the Court that this matter may be resolved short of trial.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Sandrea M Smith in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Case set for Plea and Sentencing. Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Court grants defense request. Case adjourned to branch 24.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for October 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Sandrea M Smith in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 26, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Torrie R. Williams in court.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for pre-trial conference, defendant appeared in the a.m.  Defendant failing to appear in the p.m., Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until next scheduled hearing.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Crystal M. Skybox Sports bar - 2133 N Martin Luther King.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Sanbera M Smith in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Defendant Sanbera M Smith in custody.  
Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  
Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  
Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Sanbera M Smith not in court.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is a possible victim identified, therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 2/25/15 @ 1 PM
